thread.title: Haunted houses, ghouls and other spooky adventures
thread.title_full: Haunted houses, ghouls and other spooky adventures

author: detroitnews.com
title: Haunted houses, ghouls and other spooky adventures
text:
Scarefest Screampark (Photo: Scarefest Screampark) 
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 

Haunts and screams 
Here is a partial list of places and things to bring out the screams of Halloween:

Bone Yard, doors open at dusk every Fri., Sat. (through Oct. 31). $22 for a four-ticket combo (includes the haunted house, corn maze, haunted woods and hayride). 5010 Green, Stockbridge, just west of Hell (MI). Visit boneyardhaunt.com.
Brandywine Cemetery, gates open from around 7-8:30 p.m. Oct. 30-31: See sculptures of gargoyles and props for haunted attractions. This is a non-gory, Halloween celebration and art installation. 2727 Brandywine, Ann Arbor. Visit brandywinecemetery.com.
Crypt Haunted House, dusk-12 a.m. Fri., Sat. through Oct. (also, dusk-11 p.m. Oct. 25 and 29). Once again Chemco will host the scariest haunt in Genesee County. Not recommended for small children. 4247 S. Dort Hwy., Burton. Call (810) 742-2260.
Deadland Haunted House, Fri.-Sun. (also Oct. 15, 22 and 29). $15 adults, $10 children 12 and younger. Group rates available. County Line Antique Trade Center, 20900 Dequindre (one block north of Eight Mile), Warren. Visit thedeadland.com/dates.html.
Erebus Haunted Attraction, through Nov. 1: Scream your way through four stories of thrills and chills inside Michigan’s largest haunted attraction, which held the Guinness World Record for largest walk-through haunted house from 2005-2009. 18 South Perry, downtown Pontiac. Visit hauntedpontiac.com for hours, tickets and more. Become a member and save as much as $12 per ticket with other special offers, contests and prizes.
Fear Factory, A 30-minute frightening experience with clowns, creepy creatures and undead victims. $18. Gibraltar Trade Center, Mount Clemens. Visit http://www.thefearfactory.com/ .
Hallowe’en in Greenfield Village, 6:30-9 p.m. Sat., Sun. (through Oct. 25): stroll down streets and alleys with over 1,000 carved jack-o-lanterns and costumed characters, and enjoy historically themed Hallowe’en fun. This is a rain or shine event with the complete program presented in all weather conditions. 20900 Oakwood, Dearborn. Parking is $6 for nonmembers and free for members. For tickets, call (313) 982-6001 or visit thehenryford.org/events/halloweenevent.aspx.
Panic at Pine Stump Hollow, Fri., Sat.. About a 30-minute panic experience. $12 for the haunted forest or house ($20 for both). 6310 Gratiot, St. Clair. Visit http://panicatpinestumphollow.com/).
Realm of Darkness, 7 p.m.-1 a.m. Fri., Sat. (through Oct.): See an all new 2015 show featuring the evil wizard and a second haunt called “House of Nightmares 3-D. Combo tickets available for $30. 37 Turk, Pontiac. Visit http://therealmofdarkness.com/ .
Scarefest Scream Park, 7 p.m. Fri., Sat. (through Oct. 31): All new attractions: “Castle of the Dead,” “Carnival of the Dead,” “Terror Maze Zone,” and “Hayride of Doom.” Also, a “Survive the Night Horror Campout.” $15-$95. 34111 28 Mile (northwest corner of Gratiot), Lenox Township. Call (586) 749-6666 or visit scarefestscreampark.com.
Slaughtered at Sundown Haunted House & Hayrides, Fri., Sat. (through Oct.) $15 for each attraction, or both for $25. 71800 Romeo Plank, Romeo. visit http://slaughteredatsundown.net .
Slaughterhouse Adventure & Grand River Corn Maze, Fri., Sat. (through Oct.) A scary 30-minute ride. Experience a falling tree, killer chase scene, a dragon, car wreck and even flying saucers. $15 for each attraction, two for $25 or all three for $36. 5781 Grand River, Fowlerville. Call (517) 223-9148.
Under the Big Top Spooktacular, 12:30-3:30 p.m. Oct. 24: Hosted by the Franklin Athletic Club, this is a Halloween-themed exercise and activities event. Highlights include a haunted walk, a real electric chair, karaoke, a costume contest, pumpkin decorating, face painting, trick or treating, an inflatable bounce house and more. Free. Franklin Athletic Club, 29350 Northwestern Hwy. (north of 12 Mile), Southfield. Call (248) 352-8000.
Zoo Boo, 5-8 p.m. (rain or shine) Sat., Sun. (through Oct. 18): Visit the Detroit Zoo’s annual “merry-not-scarry” Halloween celebration with a half-mile decorated trick-or-treat trail through the front area of the zoo. $8, free for those younger than two. 8450 W. 10 Mile, Royal Oak. For more information, call (248) 541-5717 or visit detroitzoo.org.
Tunnel of Terror, open 7:30-10:30 p.m. most Fri., Sat. in Oct.: A haunted house maze presented by the Rochester Area Jaycees with mayhem, darkness and horror. Rochester Municipal Park, 816 Ludlow, Rochester. $13. Visit http://rochesterareajaycees.org/ tunnelofterror/ .
Wiards Orchard Night Terrors, 7:30 p.m. Fri., Sat. (through Nov.) Features six haunted attractions in one location. Voted Michigan’s No. 1 haunted thrill park. $17.99-$55, depending on number of attractions chosen. Ticket office opens at 7:15 p.m. 5565 Merritt, Ypsilanti Township (only 15 minutes west of Metro Airport). Visit hauntedhousemichigan.com.
Compiled by Jocelynn Brown
